##Research Question

What are the local characteristics or factors influencing where new nonprofits will be established?
\newline
\newline
\newline
How important are community needs, available resources, or the existence of similar organizations for nonprofits' location?

##Implications for My Project
\begin{itemize} \itemsep1em

\item Geographic factors/spatial analysis (scale)
\pause

\item Division of "fields of activity"
\pause

\item Importance of existing nonprofit density
\pause

\item Interaction with government policy
\end{itemize}

##Main Results

Evidence of agglomeration (existing NP density)
\pause
\newline
\newline
Location factors vary across sectors and regions of Brazil.
\pause
\newline
\newline
Nonprofit density matters more than needs and resources.

##Model
\begin{small}
\begin{align*}
\text{NPO density}& =\alpha+\overbrace{\beta_1 I_{i}+\beta_2 P_{i} + \beta_3 U_{i} + \beta_4 H_i}^\text{Needs} \\[10pt]
                  & + \underbrace{\beta_5K_i +\beta_6R_i+\beta_7G_i+\beta_8C_i}_\text{Resources}+\underbrace{\beta_9N_i}_\text{Existing NP density}+\varepsilon_{i},
\end{align*}
\end{small}
where
\begin{multicols}{2}
$i$: a municipality 

$I_i$: inequality

$P_i$: poverty

$U_i$: unemployment

$H_i$: homicides

$R_i$: rural population 

$G_i$: government investment

$C_i$: state capital

$N_i$: existing NP density

\end{multicols}
